original: Engdahl, Gustaf Reinhold, major, Göteborg, f. 4/12/03 i Väckelsång, Kronob. 1., av löjtn. Sven Gustaf E. o. HiMa Maria Sandberg. G. 28 m. Maud Ernestine Elliot. KA 32, f. p-ersioimadlv :oiff. v. fisit. 42, i soc :-psyk. v. KA-imsp. 44, i ikriigsigravtj. v. flsit. 44. Priv. utir :reis. ’Siamitkomm. m. flygpil:-kry&s. Gotland t. TyskL, Holl., Span. o. Engl. 35-36. KA-kadett 23, fänr. v. KA 25, und:löjtn. 27, löjtn. 29, kapt. 36, major 45. P’lac. v. Vaxholms’ KA-reg. 25, v. Älvsb. KA-reg. fr. 42. Ka-dettoff. å flygpl :kryss. Gotland v. långresa 35-36, komp :off. v. arméns uoffsk. 36-38, chef f. KA ’Stud:komp. 35-38, skjutkurs f. res :kadetter 39-40, f. stamkad. 40, förber. art:kurs f. res:-off. 39-40, ^sign:sk. 44. translated: Engdahl, Gustaf Reinhold, Major, Gothenburg, born December 4th, 1903 in Väckelsång, Kronoberg County, firstborn of Lieutenant Sven Gustaf E. and HiMa Maria Sandberg. Married to Maud Ernestine Elliot in 1928. They have one child: Yvonne Marie-Louise, born in 1931. Completed his studentexamen in Eksjö in 1923, coast artillery officer exam at the Naval Academy in 1925, coast artillery shooting school at the Artillery Shooting School in 1928, Royal Swedish Army Staff College course in 1929-1930 with subsequent exercise in 1931, army gas-officer course in 1931 and 1934, air defense officer course at the State Defense Staff in 1932, field officer course in artillery from the Artillery and Engineering School in 1942, social and psychological course at the State Defense Staff in 1944, and war graves course at the State Defense Staff in 1944. Privately travelled to Siam as part of a delegation with a flying boat squadron to Germany, Holland, Spain, and England in 1935-1936. Enrolled at the Military Academy in 1923, promoted to second lieutenant in 1927, to lieutenant in 1929, to captain in 1936, and to major in 1945. Stationed at Vaxholm Coastal Artillery Regiment in 1925, then at Älvsborg Coastal Artillery Regiment from 1942. Cadet officer for a flying boat squadron at Gotland for a long trip in 1935-1936, company officer at the Army Noncommissioned Officers School from 1936-1938, head of the Military Academy's student company from 1935-1938, shooting course for reservist cadets in 1939-1940, standing cadet in 1940, preparatory course for artillery officers from the reserve in 1939-1940, and signed up for the army's intelligence service in 1944. Currently serving at the ammunition depot of the Swedish Armed Forces in 1940 and as an adjutant for the naval frontline artillery school in 1941. Department Chief of the regimental headquarters since 1945. Led committee for the development of a manual in hydrophonics in 1941, supplementary member for the chairman in the Director-General of Military Affairs Council in 1942-1946, a personal officer since 1942, and chairman in the civilian employee commission since 1946. Steering committee member of the Gothenburg Marine Volunteer Corps marine home since 1942, in the Swedish Flag Association's working committee for Gothenburg since 1943, in the bishopric's KA 4 soldier home since 1944, and treasurer for various non-profit associations. Authored several compendiums on military topics from 1931-1935. Recipient of the Royal Order of the Sword.

structured.name: Gustaf Reinhold Engdahl

memberOf.name: Gothenburg Marine Volunteer Corps Marine Home

structured.description: Gustaf Reinhold Engdahl was a Swedish Major born on December 4th, 1903 in Väckelsång, Kronoberg County. He completed his studentexamen in Eksjö in 1923 and had extensive military education. Engdahl was stationed in various organizations including Vaxholm Coastal Artillery Regiment, Älvsborg Coastal Artillery Regiment, Swedish Armed Forces Ammunition Depot, and Naval Frontline Artillery School. He was also a member of several associations such as Swedish Flag Association, KA 4 Soldier Home, Gothenburg Marine Volunteer Corps Marine Home, Director-General of Military Affairs Council, and Civilian Employee Commission.
